intro: Calochortus nuttallii var. subalpinus, commonly known as the Sierra lilies, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the genus Calochortus, which includes a variety of flowering plants commonly referred to as mariposa lilies. This particular variety is characterized by its showy, cup-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and yellow. It typically grows in rocky soils at high elevations, often in alpine or subalpine habitats. The plant is known for its resilience in harsh environmental conditions and is often found in meadows and open slopes.
